Description: The Return of the Holy Family from Egypt, with God the Father in clouds above, and angels holding the Cross, study for an altarpiece (?), formerly in an album originally containing 62 drawings; the Christ Child flanked by the Virgin and Joseph walking to foreground, arched Black chalk, grey-brown wash, on light brown paper
Curator's comments: See curator's comment to 1950-11-11-2. There is no painting related to this study from the Spanish period (1692-1702). A more fluid drawing of the same composition is in the Uffizi, Florence (6707 S; Ferrari and Scavizzi, I, no. D151, II, fig. 1035). Scavizzi and Ferrari date both drawings to c. 1694-6. Ferrari (1966) comments on the BM drawing's compositional similarity to an earlier Giordano painting of 1660 in S. Giuseppe a Pontecorvo (S. Giuseppe delle Scalze), Naples (Ferrari fig. 33). Lit.: O. Ferrari, 'Drawings by Luca Giordano in the British Museum', "The Burlington Magazine", CVIII, June 1966, p. 302, fig. 32; O. Ferrari and G Scavizzi, 'Luca Giordano', 1966, II, p. 256; W. Vitzthum, review of the above, "The Burlington Magazine", CXII, 1970, p. 302, fig. 33; O. Ferrari and G. Scavizzi, 'Luca Giordano', Naples, 1992, I, pp. 184, 273 and 375, no. D150, II, fig. 1037
Funder name: Funded by: H L Florence Fund
Acquisition notes: This item has an uncertain or incomplete provenance for the years 1933-45. The British Museum welcomes information and assistance in the investigation and clarification of the provenance of all works during that era. For further information on the album see acquisition comment in 1950-11-11-2.
